DeleteClass.Title: Delete
DeleteClass.LongHelp: If you select one object, to also delete its children, select the Include structural objects option
DeleteLibrary.Title: Delete
DeleteLibrary.LongHelp: If you select one object, to also delete its children, select the Include structural objects option
MoveClass.Title: Move
MoveClass.ShortHelp: Moves the selected objects to another class.
MoveClass.LongHelp: Search the targeted class and select it.
ActionBar_Attributes.Title: Information
ActionBar_Attributes.ShortHelp: Opens the Information widget, and provides information about the selected objects.
ActionBar_Attributes.LongHelp: You can edit the properties of the objects from the Properties tab. Depending on the type of the selected objects, other tabs are available.
Favorites_Add_Remove.Title: Add/Remove to/from Favorites
Favorites_Add_Remove.ShortHelp: Adds or removes library or class categorized as favorite.
Favorites_Add_Remove.LongHelp:
Select a library or class in the tree section and click this command to add the library or class as favorite.

From the favorites or the libraries or the root library section, select a library or class marked as favorite and click this command to remove it from favorites.
ExportAttributes.Title: Export Attributes
CreateNewClass.Title: New Class
CreateNewClass.LongHelp:
Select a library or a class and click this command to create a new class under it.

The new class inherits the purpose of its parent library or class and it cannot be modified.
CreateNewLibrary.Title: New Library
CreateNewLibrary.LongHelp: Select libraries section and click this command to create a library.
CreateNewDefinitionLibrary.Title: New Definition Library
CreateNewDefinitionLibrary.LongHelp: You can use the definition library to classify items according to their essential characteristics.
CreateNewStandardLibrary.Title: New Categorization Library
CreateNewStandardLibrary.LongHelp: You can use the Categorization library to classify items according to their nonessential characteristics.
RemoveAttributes.Title: Remove
RemoveAttributes.ShortHelp: Removes the selected attributes from the class.
RemoveAttributes.LongHelp:
From classification attributes tab, select one or more attributes and click this command to remove the selected attributes.

You can remove the attributes from a class only if it is in the Draft or In Work maturity state.
AddExistingAttributes.Title: Add Existing Attributes
AddExistingAttributes.LongHelp:
From classification attributes tab, click this command and select attributes to add.

You can add the attributes to a class only if it is in the Draft or In Work maturity state.
ExportLibrary.Title: Export Library
ExportLibrary.ShortHelp: Exports the contents of the library as an xml file.
ExportLibrary.LongHelp: Select a root library from tree or content section and click this command to export it.
ClassAttributesTools.Title: Attribute Tools
DeleteAttributes.Title: Delete
EditAttributes.Title: Edit mode
EditAttributes.ShortHelp: This command switchs view to edit mode.
downloadCAT.Title: Download CATNLS
downloadCAT.ShortHelp: This command downloads CATNls for the attributes.
CancelUpdates.Title: Undo Edit
SaveUpdates.Title: Save Updates
NewStringAttribute.Title: String
NewIntegerAttribute.Title: Integer
NewRealAttribute.Title: Real
NewBooleanAttribute.Title: Boolean
NewDateAttribute.Title: Date
NewDimentionalAttribute.Title: Attribute with dimension
CreateLink.Title: Copy Link
CreateLink.ShortHelp: Copy link of library to share/open it later.
ImportLibrary.Title: Import Library
ImportLibrary.LongHelp:
Click on this command, and select appropriate xml file.

Click on validate button to validate the structure of selected xml file.

Click on import button, to import the libary structure
RenameCmd.Title: Rename
RenameCmd.LongHelp:
From tree or content section, select library or class to rename.

Click on this command and provide new name.
thumbnailview.Title: Thumbnail View
datagridview.Title: Table
tileview.Title: Tile View
AddExistingContent.Title: Add Existing Content
AddExistingContent.LongHelp:
Click this command and enter a query in the dialog box to search for the required content.

Select the required content and click OK to add the content to the selected class.
RemoveContent.Title: Remove
RemoveContent.ShortHelp: Removes the selected content from the class.
RemoveContent.LongHelp: From the class, select one or more objects and click this command to remove the selected content.
ReplaceByLatestRevision.Title: Replace By Latest Revision
ReplaceByLatestRevision.ShortHelp: Replaces the selected content by its latest Revision.
ReplaceByLatestRevision.LongHelp: Select one or more objects in the content view in the class and click the command to replace the selected content by its latest revision.
ReplaceByRevision.Title: Replace By Revision
ReplaceByRevision.ShortHelp: Replaces the selected content by one of its revisions.
ReplaceByRevision.LongHelp: Select a content in content view in the class and click this command. From the Replace By Revision panel, select the required revision to replace the selected content in the content view by its revision.
openWith.Title: Open With
openWith.ShortHelp: Opens the selected content in the suitable application.
openWith.LongHelp: Select content in the Class Content View and click this command. A menu of applications appears, select the one with which the content should open.
